title: Japan: an industrial nation at work
brief_description: Describes the industries of Japan, such as shipbuilding, automobile construction, the production of textiles and china-ware, the iron and steel industry, and the pearl industry. Points out the location of the largest industrial cities, and discusses the importance of raw materials which are essential to Japan’s manufacturing industry.
